metadata.title: CVE-2016-3718 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) HTTP and (2) FTP coders in ImageMagick before 6.9.3-10 and 7.xbefore 7.0.1-1 allow remote attackers to conduct server-side requestforgery (SSRF) attacks via a crafted image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.1').
graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1').
